intro: Phlegmariurus huberi, commonly known as the African haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to blackish-green foliage. The leaves are typically elongated and have a distinct costa, which is more prominent towards the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. This moss plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
